summary: This document is a summary of account transactions for Jeffrey Epstein's account at Deutsche Bank for the month of April 2019. It details various debits and credits, including significant outgoing transfers to other accounts, payroll fees, and other transactions, reflecting Epstein's financial activities during this period.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Jeffrey Epstein is the primary account holder for the financial transactions detailed in this document, which outlines his account balances and activities.

persons.name: Stewart Oldfield
persons.context: Stewart Oldfield is mentioned as a contact for personal assistance regarding the account.

persons.name: George Braitain
persons.context: George Braitain is mentioned as a recipient of outgoing money transfers from Epstein's account.

connections.description: Stewart Oldfield is a representative at Deutsche Bank who assists Jeffrey Epstein with his banking needs.
George Braitain is associated with Epstein through financial transactions, receiving funds from Epstein's account.

events.title: Account Summary for April 2019
events.description: The document summarizes the financial transactions of Jeffrey Epstein's account for the month of April 2019, including significant debits and credits.

locations: 6100 Red Hook Quarter, B3, St. Thomas 00802, United States
keyFacts: The document details a balance of $42,953,424 in Epstein's business checking account as of April 1, 2019.
Significant outgoing transfers include $100,000 to TD Bank and $10,000 to George Braitain Land Design Inc.
Multiple preauthorized debits for payroll fees and taxes were recorded throughout the month.
The ending balance as of April 30, 2019, was $160,533.29 after various transactions.
